Legal_Issue: Whether the Refugee Protection Division applied the correct legal test for state protection
Application_Facts: A Hungarian Roma family claimed refugee status due to discrimination and lack of state protection in Hungary
Decision_Outcome: The application for judicial review is allowed; the matter is remitted to another member for reconsideration
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review sought by the Minister of Citizenship and Immigration
Court_Ruling: Federal Court found the Board applied an incorrect legal standard
Claimant_Status: Hungarian Roma family claiming refugee status
Grounds_for_Claim: Discrimination and lack of state protection in Hungary
Legal_Standard: Claimant must provide clear and convincing evidence to rebut the presumption of state protection on a balance of probabilities
Assessment_Factor: Inconsistency in the threshold used by the Board: initially correct standard, later applied a lower 'somewhat rebut' standard
Procedural_Issue: Board's inconsistent application of legal standards during decision-making
Review_Standard: Correctness or reasonableness (implied by judicial review context)
Application_Basis: Rebuttal of presumption of state protection
Governing_Rule: Claimant must rebut presumption of state protection with clear and convincing evidence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Use of a lower evidentiary threshold than required ('somewhat rebut')
Outcome: Refugee status initially granted, set aside on judicial review, case remitted
Harm_Assessment: Alleged harm due to systemic discrimination against Roma in Hungary
Cause_Description: Hungarian Roma family facing discrimination and inadequate state protection
Evidence_Handling: Failure to consistently apply proper legal test in evaluating evidence
Evidence_Issues: Inconsistent evaluation of whether claimants met burden of proof
Evidence_Assessment: Board allowed 'somewhat rebut' instead of full rebuttal on balance of probabilities
Decision_Rationale: Doubt about which legal test was applied due to inconsistency in standard
Legal_Standard_Applied: Incorrectly applied a lower 'somewhat rebut' standard instead of balance of probabilities
